docker.service-logs.description: Collect logs from a docker swarm service. One of `service` or `service_list_options` is required.

_ext_outputs.description: The stdout output of the logs call. Will generate this file for each matched service
The stderr output of the logs call. Will generate this file for each matched service

container_logs_options.description: Args as would be given to `docker logs`, as in [The Docker API](https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/api/types/client.go#L73)

Details.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Follow.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

ShowStderr.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

ShowStdout.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Since.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Tail.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Timestamps.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

Until.description: Same as would be passed to `docker logs`

service.description: A single docker swarm service for which to collect logs

service_list_options.description: Options for filtering all swarm services

Filters.description: Same as would be passed to `docker service ls`

.*.description: Same as would be passed to `docker service ls`

reverse.description: Store logs in reverse chronological order

kubernetes.api-versions.description: The API versions of the Kubernetes cluster

_ext_outputs.description: A json file holding a list of the API versions
A json file holding the Kubernetes cluster info

kubernetes.container-cp.description: Collect a file or directory from one or more kubernetes pods and containers. If the container name is not specified, files will be collected from all containers within the pods.

_ext_outputs.description: A directory holding files copied from the pod and containers specified. Each pod and container will have a directory. Used when neither a pod name or a namespace is provided.
A directory holding files copied from the pod and containers specified. Each pod and container will have a directory. Used when a pod name is not provided.
A directory holding files copied from the pod and containers specified. Each container will have a directory. Used when a pod name is provided, but a namespace is not.
A directory holding files copied from the pod and containers specified. Each container will have a directory. Used when a pod name is provided.

container.description: The Kubernetes container. If omitted, files will be copied from all containers in matched pods

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace. If no namespace is provided, results from all namespaces are included

pod_list_options.description: The Kubernetes pod query options (used when querying for a label selector)

labelSelector.description: The Kubernetes pod label selector to query by

src_path.description: The path to copy from within the container

kubernetes.logs.description: Collect the logs for one or more kubernetes pods

_ext_outputs.description: Logs pulled from Kubernetes pod. Kubernetes pulls logs from stdout/stderr into one output file. If a label selector is provided, it will create multiple log files following the same format. Used when a namespace is not provided.
Logs pulled from Kubernetes pod. Kubernetes pulls logs from stdout/stderr into one output file. If a label selector is provided, it will create multiple log files following the same format.

list_options.description: The Kubernetes pod query options (used when querying for a label selector)

labelSelector.description: The Kubernetes pod label selector to query logs by

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace. If no namespace is provided, results from all namespaces are included

kubernetes.resource-list.description: Collect a list of resources managed by the cluster

_ext_outputs.description: Logs pulled from Kubernetes pod. Kubernetes pulls logs from stdout/stderr into one output file. If a label selector is provided, it will create multiple log files following the same format.

group_version.description: Optionally override the default group and version for the resource kind (in the format "group/version").

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource kind, as would be passed to `kubectl get`

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace. If no namespace is provided, results from all namespaces are included

_ext_outputs.description: A json file containing the version information of the Kubernetes cluster

logs.description: Debug level logs from the support bundle progam

_ext_outputs.description: Debug logs

meta.description: Can be used to organize and identify analyze elements

labels.description: Key,value pairs used to organize and identify analyze elements

name.description: Name used to organize and identify analyze elements

meta.redact.description: A list of scrubbers to apply to all assets. If multiple 'meta.redact' specs are specified, all lists will be used. If a spec specifies a scrubber, it will be run in addition to the global scrubbers.

_ext_outputs.description: A list of scrubs that were added globally by this item

scrubs.description: the list of scrubbers to apply to all outputs

_ext_outputs.description: The stdout from the command
The stdin from the command

os.http-request.description: Collect information about the response from making an HTTP request

_ext_outputs.description: The response body

header.description: One or more headers to send

insecure.description: Set to `true` to skip TLS verification

_ext_outputs.description: The raw loadavg info

template.description: (Optional) a template for the human-readable output

os.read-file.description: Read a file or a directory from the filesystem

_ext_outputs.description: The file contents

filepath.description: The file path on the host. If running Support Bundle via docker, this will work, but symlinks are not supported

os.run-command.description: Run a command. Will be run in the support bundle container if `docker run replicated/support-bundle` is used. To run in a custom container, use `docker.run` instead

_ext_outputs.description: The standard error of the command
examples:
Usage: ping [-aAbBdDfhLnOqrRUvV] [-c count] [-i interval] [-I interface]
 [-m mark] [-M pmtudisc_option] [-l preload] [-p pattern] [-Q tos]
 [-s packetsize] [-S sndbuf] [-t ttl] [-T timestamp_option]
 [-w deadline] [-W timeout] [hop1 ...] destination

_ext_outputs.description: The standard output of the command
examples:
PING google.com (172.217.11.78) 56(84) bytes of data.
 64 bytes from lax17s34-in-f14.1e100.net (172.217.11.78): icmp_seq=1 ttl=54 time=203 ms
 64 bytes from lax17s34-in-f14.1e100.net (172.217.11.78): icmp_seq=2 ttl=54 time=28.0 ms
 64 bytes from lax17s34-in-f14.1e100.net (172.217.11.78): icmp_seq=3 ttl=54 time=130 ms

dir.description: The working directory of the command

os.uptime.description: Collect information about the system's uptime

_ext_outputs.description: The contents of the uptime file

retraced.events.description: Collect Audit Log events from a running Audit Log instance

_ext_outputs.description: The audit events in CSV format

api_endpoint.description: The location of the Audit Logs API endpoint in the form `http(s)://<host>:<port>`

api_token.description: An API token for communicating with the audit log instance

insecure.description: Set to `true` to skip SSL verification on the endpoint

mask.description: A mask to determine what fields to include in the output file, as in https://github.com/retracedhq/retraced-go/blob/master/graphql.go#L160

query.description: A structured query for filtering events, as in https://github.com/retracedhq/retraced-go/blob/master/graphql.go#L16

lifecycle.description: `lifecycle` can be used to customize the end-customer's experience when generating/uploading support bundles

items.description: `lifecycle` can be used to customize the end-customer's experience when generating/uploading support bundles

generate.description: Adds a step that will generate a support bundle. It has one argument, use_defaults

use_defaults.description: Whether to include the default support bundle files - cpu info, docker ps, etc

message.description: Adds a step to print a message to the end customer

examples.contents: This process will collect a number of files from the host system to help you debug your problem

notes.description: Adds a step to prompt the end customer to enter a note to be uploaded with the support bundle

examples.prompt: Please enter a note for the support bundle:

prompt.description: the message prompt to display to the end customer for entering a note

upload.description: Adds a step in which the end customer can upload a bundle to https://vendor.replicated.com for review by the vendor

prompt.message: Would you like to upload your generated support bundle for review? -
prompt.accept: Bundle uploaded! SuperGoodTool support will get back to you within 24 hours
prompt.decline: Bundle was not uploaded, please send your bundle to SuperGoodTool support

prompt.description: Allows configuring an interactive prompt for the user to confirm before uploading

accept.description: A message to display if the user accepts the upload prompt

decline.description: A message to display if the user declines the upload prompt

default.description: The default answer to the prompt

analyzeCondition.description: A statement to be validated. Uses variables as input and results in insights.

and.description: A list of conditions evaluated with the and operator

items.description: A list of conditions evaluated with the and operator

empty.description: Checks that a variable is empty

eval.description: Evaluates a templated string. "{{repl .Ref}} can be used to refer to a variableRef."

labels.description: Key,value pairs used to organize and identify the condition

gte.description: Greater than or equal to comparison

items.description: List of equal to comparison

lte.description: Less than or equal to comparison

or.description: A list of conditions evaluated with the or operator

items.description: A list of conditions evaluated with the or operator

regexpMatch.description: Matches a variable against a regular expression

gte.description: Greater than or equal to comparison

items.description: List of equal to comparison

lte.description: Less than or equal to comparison

analyzeInsight.description: An insight represents a message with severity to be surfaced to the end-user

detail.description: A detailed message to display to the user

labels.description: Key,value pairs used to organize and identify the insight

primary.description: A short message to display to the user
